title: A Holiday Gift Guide for Design Lovers: 10 Ideas Under $300 (and One Splurge)
sub_head: This season’s gift ethos is optimism, a return to fun. From a happy, high-design coat hook to a roses-emblazoned quilt, these décor gifts will perk up both your giftee’s living space and your giftee.
body:
AT THE HEIGHT of the lockdown last year, our annual design gift guide focused on the practical. Proposing onyx trinket boxes seemed tone-deaf in a pandemic. But as the era of toilet-paper hoarding winds down, a little frivolity in gift-giving doesn’t seem so crass. A crimson cuckoo clock? Not completely necessary, but why not? Serving trays so energetically patterned they’ll rev up a party? The entertainer in your life will love it. Not that we’re plugging profligacy. Only one idea, a splurge, costs over $300, but all of the upbeat, interior-design presents below send the following message of optimism to your giftee: Live a little.
Unless she’s a grump, the host on your list will welcome the rave-up of color these melamine platters bring to a party. Hues like sunshine yellow, aqua, bubblegum pink and orange nearly vibrate next to each other, a nod to the spirited patterns that creator Yinka Ilori remembers his British-Nigerian family wearing when he was a boy. Said the London-based artist of his agreeable agenda, “I celebrate joy and optimism through color.” Ere Tray, $63, dwr.com
